Micky Ward.Action: Asks his half-brother Dicky to help him finish spreading asphalt and playfully spar with him while working hard.
Engages in playful sparring and joking with his brother Dicky, participates in their mutual teasing.
Counts like a referee, encourages Dicky to continue sparring, checking on him.
Plays along with Dicky's playful antics, hams up going down comically.

Participates in raising arms together, celebrating brotherly bond and success.
Joins in dancing with Alice and her sisters on the crowded dance floor.
Observes Charlene Fleming hesitantly participating in shots and is attentive to her actions.
Drinks water and watches others from afar instead of joining the drinking and jokes.

Responds to Charlene's teasing remarks with brief, somewhat defensive replies but does not engage confidently or skillfully in conversation.

Slaps the drunk guy twice quickly to stop him from disrespecting Charlene, tells him to be nice and respectful.
Shows a bit of frustration and looks away when the drunk guy jeers that he will lose again.
Defends Charlene from disrespect courteously instead of escalating violence further.

Kisses smiling Micky on the cheek, expresses affection towards brother.

Remains focused and oblivious to a fight breaking out nearby, showing single-mindedness.
Engages positively with family banter and laughter in the gym, showing familiarity and lightheartedness.

Laughs along with reporters during light family banter, showing comfort in public settings and media interactions.

Calmly singing quietly to himself to manage nerves before the fight.

Throws a combination of hook-uppercut-uppercut-hook despite taking heavy body punches.
Takes multiple hard punches in close but continues trading blows instead of protecting himself adequately.
Almost falls out of the ring, only saved by the ropes, indicating vulnerability and perhaps lack of defensive competence at this moment.
Despite being hurt and under heavy pressure, tries to hold on and continue fighting.

Throws right and left punches aggressively despite unsteady legs, showing resilience and tactical awareness to get off the ropes and counterattack.

Looks down and hugs his brother's head between his gloves, laughing.
